body.raw:
{
  "name": "Summer Sale",
  "email": "{{$randomFirstName}}@gmail.com",
  "discountValue": 25,
  "valueType": "PERCENTAGE",
  "code": "Summer{{$randomFirstName}}",
  "description": "A special 25% off for all summer services.",
  "referralType": "REFERRAL",
  "reusable": false,
  "maxUsagePerUser": 6607.5143414435015,
  "validFrom": "2025-10-18T10:46:43.199Z",
  "validTo": "2026-10-11T05:58:56.374Z",
  "categories": [
    "{{discountCategoryId}}"

exec: pm.test("Status code is 2xx or 4xx/5xx as expected", function () {
pm.test("Response time is less than 2000ms", function () {
// 1. Assert the response status code is 200
// 2. Validate that the response body is valid JSON
pm.test("Response body is valid JSON", function () {
// 3. Assert top-level keys and their types
pm.test("Response has required top-level keys with correct types", function () {
// 4. Assert data object keys and their types
pm.test("Data object has required keys with correct types", function () {
// 5. If rewards array is not empty, check each reward object for expected fields and types
pm.test("Each reward object has expected fields and types (if rewards array is not empty)", function () {
pm.expect(reward.id, `Reward at index ${idx} 'id' should be string or number`).to.satisfy(val => typeof val === "string" || typeof val === "number");
pm.expect(reward.type, `Reward at index ${idx} 'type' should be string`).to.be.a("string");
pm.expect(reward.amount, `Reward at index ${idx} 'amount' should be number`).to.be.a("number");
pm.expect(reward.date, `Reward at index ${idx} 'date' should be string`).to.be.a("string");
